about.name: Maldives
about.info_text: The Maldives is a tropical paradise made up of 26 coral atolls and over 1,000 coral islands in the Indian Ocean. Known for its stunning white-sand beaches, crystal-clear waters, and vibrant marine life, it's a dream destination for beach lovers and water enthusiasts. Visitors to the Maldives can enjoy overwater bungalows, snorkeling in coral reefs, water sports, and the ultimate in relaxation. It's a haven for those seeking luxury, romance, and natural beauty.
about.facts_text:
Population: Approximately 520,000
Capital: Malé
Time Zone: Maldives Standard Time (GMT+5:00)
Language: Dhivehi
Currency: Maldivian Rufiyaa (MVR)
about.climate_text: The Maldives has a tropical monsoon climate, with distinct wet and dry seasons. Temperatures typically range from 24°C (75°F) to 33°C (91°F). The best time to visit is during the dry northeast monsoon season, from November to March.

attractions_card.title: Overwater Bungalows
attractions_card.description: The Maldives is famous for its luxurious overwater bungalows, offering direct access to the clear waters and stunning ocean views.

attractions_card.title: Coral Reefs
attractions_card.description: The Maldives boasts some of the world's most vibrant coral reefs, ideal for snorkeling and scuba diving to explore a diverse range of marine life.

attractions_card.title: Manta Ray Watching
attractions_card.description: The Maldives is a prime location for observing manta rays and other marine creatures in their natural habitat.

attractions_card.title: Underwater Restaurants
attractions_card.description: Experience the unique dining experience of underwater restaurants, where you can enjoy a meal surrounded by marine life.

attractions_card.title: Water Sports
attractions_card.description: The Maldives offers a range of water sports, including windsurfing, jet-skiing, paddleboarding, and sailing.

attractions_card.title: Fishing
attractions_card.description: Try your hand at fishing in the Indian Ocean. The Maldives is known for its deep-sea and night fishing excursions.

attractions_card.title: Local Culture
attractions_card.description: Explore the local Maldivian culture by visiting fishing villages, attending traditional Bodu Beru drumming performances, and sampling Maldivian cuisine.

food_card.title: Fish Curry
food_card.description: Fish curry is a staple in Maldivian cuisine, typically prepared with coconut milk and served with rice or flatbreads.

food_card.title: Hedhikaa
food_card.description: Hedhikaa refers to a variety of traditional Maldivian snacks, including fish pastries, coconut-stuffed bread, and more.

food_card.title: Coconut-Based Dishes
food_card.description: Coconut is a key ingredient in many Maldivian dishes, from coconut rice to coconut sambol and roshi (flatbread).

food_card.title: Maldivian Tuna Salad
food_card.description: Tuna salad, often mixed with coconut, lime, and chili, is a popular and refreshing dish.

food_card.title: Fresh Seafood
food_card.description: With an abundance of fresh seafood, the Maldives offers an array of grilled, baked, and fried seafood dishes.

hotels_card.title: Gili Lankanfushi
hotels_card.description: Gili Lankanfushi is a luxury eco-resort with overwater villas, perfect for a romantic and secluded escape.

hotels_card.title: Six Senses Laamu
hotels_card.description: Six Senses Laamu offers sustainable luxury, with private water villas and a focus on wellness and relaxation.

hotels_card.title: Conrad Maldives Rangali Island
hotels_card.description: Conrad Maldives Rangali Island is known for its underwater restaurant and a range of luxurious accommodations.

hotels_card.title: Velassaru Maldives
hotels_card.description: Velassaru Maldives provides a mix of modern luxury, stunning beaches, and a range of water and land activities.

hotels_card.title: Anantara Dhigu Maldives Resort
hotels_card.description: Anantara Dhigu offers a family-friendly experience with beachfront villas and a variety of dining options.

transport_card.title: Seaplane Transfer
transport_card.description: Many resorts in the Maldives are accessed via seaplane, providing a scenic arrival experience.

transport_card.title: Speedboat Transfer
transport_card.description: Some resorts offer speedboat transfers from the main airport in Malé to their private islands.

transport_card.title: Domestic Flights
transport_card.description: To reach more remote atolls, you can take domestic flights from Malé to regional airports.

transport_card.title: Traditional Dhoni Boats
transport_card.description: Local dhoni boats are commonly used for transportation between islands and for fishing trips.
